conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the block and the plank to determine the condition for upward movement.
Horizontal Force (F1) is applied to the block on the left side of the plank.
Vertical Force (F2) is applied to the plank on the right side of the block.
Static friction coefficient is 0.20, equal to kinetic friction.
Maximum friction force is calculated as 1.6 N using F_friction = mu * m * g.
Kinetic friction force is also 1.6 N, equal to the friction force.
Net force on the block is F1 + F_friction = mg.
Solve for F1 to find F1 = 2.4 N.
Horizontal force F1 must be 2.4 N for the plank to move upward.
